name.label: Block Name
name.text: The name for a block is a unique string that identifies a block. Names have to be structured as namespace/block-name, where namespace is the name of your plugin or theme.

title.label: Block Title
title.text: This is the display title for your block, which can be translated with WordPress translation functions. The title will display in the Inserter and in other areas of the editor.

description.label: Block Description
description.text: This is the short descriptor for your block, which can be translated with WordPress translation functions. The description will display in the block inspector.

keywords.label: Block Keywords
keywords.text: Sometimes its helpful for users to have terms other than a block's title to discover it. For example, an image block could also want to be discovered by photo. You can do so by providing an array of unlimited terms (which are translated).

category.label: Block Category
category.text: The category is where you block is grouped when browsing in the Inserter. These categories help users browse and discover blocks.

anchor.label: Anchor
anchor.text: Anchors let you link directly to a specific block on a page. This property adds a field to define an id for the block and a button to copy the direct link.

align.label: Align
align.text: Alignment adds block controls which allow changing the block's alignment.

color.label: Color
color.text: Color adds block controls which allow changing the block's color.

multiple.label: Multiple
multiple.text: If a block is flagged as non-multiple, it can be inserted into each post one time only. The icon will be dimmed and be unclickable in the Inserter if an instance is already in the post.

reusable.label: Reusable
reusable.text: By default all blocks can be converted to a reusable block. If unchecked, the option to convert this block into a reusable block will not appear.

renaming.label: Renaming
renaming.text: By default, a block can be renamed by a user from the block 'Options' dropdown or the 'Advanced' panel. To disable this behavior, this flag can be unchecked.

shadow.label: Shadow
shadow.text: When checked, the block editor will show UI controls for shadows, allowing the user to set a box shadow for the block.

spacing.label: Spacing
spacing.text: When checked, the block editor will show UI controls for spacing, allowing the user to set spacing as defined by the theme.

typography.label: Typography
typography.text: When checked, the block editor will show UI controls for typography, allowing the user to set typography as defined by the theme.
